trans-unit.source: Batch and HPC solutions in the Azure cloud
trans-unit.target: Batch and HPC solutions in the Azure cloud

trans-unit.source: Azure offers efficient, scalable cloud solutions for batch and high performance computing (HPC) - also called *Big Compute*.
trans-unit.target: Azure offers efficient, scalable cloud solutions for batch and high performance computing (HPC) - also called *Big Compute*.

trans-unit.source: Learn here about Big Compute workloads and Azure’s services to support them, or jump directly to [solution scenarios](#scenarios) later in this article.
trans-unit.target: Learn here about Big Compute workloads and Azure’s services to support them, or jump directly to [solution scenarios](#scenarios) later in this article.

trans-unit.source: This article is mainly for technical decision-makers, IT managers, and independent software vendors, but other IT professionals and developers can use it to familiarize themselves with these solutions.
trans-unit.target: This article is mainly for technical decision-makers, IT managers, and independent software vendors, but other IT professionals and developers can use it to familiarize themselves with these solutions.

trans-unit.source: Organizations have large-scale computing problems including engineering design and analysis, image rendering, complex modeling, Monte Carlo simulations, and financial risk calculations.
trans-unit.target: Organizations have large-scale computing problems including engineering design and analysis, image rendering, complex modeling, Monte Carlo simulations, and financial risk calculations.

trans-unit.source: Azure helps organizations solve these problems and make decisions with the resources, scale, and schedule they need.
trans-unit.target: Azure helps organizations solve these problems and make decisions with the resources, scale, and schedule they need.

trans-unit.source: With Azure, organizations can:
trans-unit.target: With Azure, organizations can:

trans-unit.target: Create hybrid solutions, extending an on-premises HPC cluster to offload peak workloads to the cloud

trans-unit.target: Run HPC cluster tools and workloads entirely in Azure

trans-unit.target: Use a managed and scalable Azure service such as [Batch](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/batch/) to run compute-intensive workloads without having to deploy and manage compute infrastructure

trans-unit.target: Although beyond the scope of this article, Azure also provides developers and partners a full set of capabilities, architecture choices, and development tools to build large-scale, custom Big Compute workflows.

trans-unit.source: Batch and HPC applications
trans-unit.target: Batch and HPC applications

trans-unit.source: Unlike web applications and many line-of-business applications, batch and HPC applications have a defined beginning and end, and they can run on a schedule or on demand, sometimes for hours or longer.
trans-unit.target: Unlike web applications and many line-of-business applications, batch and HPC applications have a defined beginning and end, and they can run on a schedule or on demand, sometimes for hours or longer.

trans-unit.source: Most fall into two main categories: *intrinsically parallel* (sometimes called “embarrassingly parallel”, because the problems they solve lend themselves to running in parallel on multiple computers or processors) and *tightly coupled*.
trans-unit.target: Most fall into two main categories: *intrinsically parallel* (sometimes called “embarrassingly parallel”, because the problems they solve lend themselves to running in parallel on multiple computers or processors) and *tightly coupled*.

trans-unit.source: See the following table for more about these application types.
trans-unit.target: See the following table for more about these application types.

trans-unit.source: Some Azure solution approaches work better for one type or the other.
trans-unit.target: Some Azure solution approaches work better for one type or the other.

trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] In Batch and HPC solutions, a running instance of an application is typically called a *job*, and each job might get divided into *tasks*.

trans-unit.source: And the clustered compute resources for the application are often called *compute nodes*.

trans-unit.source: Considerations for running batch and HPC applications in the cloud
trans-unit.target: Considerations for running batch and HPC applications in the cloud

trans-unit.source: You can readily migrate many applications that are designed to run in on-premises HPC clusters to Azure, or to a hybrid (cross-premises) environment.
trans-unit.target: You can readily migrate many applications that are designed to run in on-premises HPC clusters to Azure, or to a hybrid (cross-premises) environment.

trans-unit.source: However, there may be some limitations or considerations, including:
trans-unit.target: However, there may be some limitations or considerations, including:

trans-unit.source: **Availability of cloud resources** - Depending on the type of cloud compute resources you use, you might not be able to rely on continuous machine availability for the duration of a job's execution.
trans-unit.target: **Availability of cloud resources** - Depending on the type of cloud compute resources you use, you might not be able to rely on continuous machine availability for the duration of a job's execution.

trans-unit.source: State handling and progress check pointing are common techniques to handle possible transient failures, and more necessary when leveraging cloud resources.
trans-unit.target: State handling and progress check pointing are common techniques to handle possible transient failures, and more necessary when leveraging cloud resources.

trans-unit.source: **Data access** - Data access techniques commonly available within an enterprise network cluster, such as NFS, may require special configuration in the cloud, or you might need to adopt different data access practices and patterns for the cloud.
trans-unit.target: **Data access** - Data access techniques commonly available within an enterprise network cluster, such as NFS, may require special configuration in the cloud, or you might need to adopt different data access practices and patterns for the cloud.

trans-unit.source: **Data movement** - For applications that process large amounts of data, strategies are needed to move the data into cloud storage and to compute resources, and you might need high-speed cross-premises networking such as [Azure ExpressRoute](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/expressroute/).
trans-unit.target: **Data movement** - For applications that process large amounts of data, strategies are needed to move the data into cloud storage and to compute resources, and you might need high-speed cross-premises networking such as [Azure ExpressRoute](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/expressroute/).

trans-unit.source: Also consider legal, regulatory, or policy limitations for storing or accessing that data.
trans-unit.target: Also consider legal, regulatory, or policy limitations for storing or accessing that data.

trans-unit.source: **Licensing** - Check with the vendor of any commercial application for licensing or other restrictions for running in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: **Licensing** - Check with the vendor of any commercial application for licensing or other restrictions for running in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Not all vendors offer pay-as-you-go licensing.
trans-unit.target: Not all vendors offer pay-as-you-go licensing.

trans-unit.source: You might need to plan for a licensing server in the cloud for your solution, or connect to an on-premises license server.
trans-unit.target: You might need to plan for a licensing server in the cloud for your solution, or connect to an on-premises license server.

trans-unit.source: Big Compute or Big Data?
trans-unit.target: Big Compute or Big Data?

trans-unit.source: The dividing line between Big Compute and Big Data applications isn't always clear, and some applications may have characteristics of both.
trans-unit.target: The dividing line between Big Compute and Big Data applications isn't always clear, and some applications may have characteristics of both.

trans-unit.source: Both involve running large-scale computations, usually on clusters of computers.
trans-unit.target: Both involve running large-scale computations, usually on clusters of computers.

trans-unit.source: But the solution approaches and supporting tools can differ.
trans-unit.target: But the solution approaches and supporting tools can differ.

trans-unit.source: • **Big Compute** tends to involve applications that rely on CPU power and memory, such as engineering simulations, financial risk modeling, and digital rendering.
trans-unit.target: • **Big Compute** tends to involve applications that rely on CPU power and memory, such as engineering simulations, financial risk modeling, and digital rendering.

trans-unit.source: The clusters that power a Big Compute solution might include computers with specialized multicore processors to perform raw computation, and specialized, high speed networking hardware to connect the computers.
trans-unit.target: The clusters that power a Big Compute solution might include computers with specialized multicore processors to perform raw computation, and specialized, high speed networking hardware to connect the computers.

trans-unit.source: • **Big Data** solves data analysis problems that involve large amounts of data that can’t be managed by a single computer or database management system, such as large volumes of web logs or other business intelligence data.
trans-unit.target: • **Big Data** solves data analysis problems that involve large amounts of data that can’t be managed by a single computer or database management system, such as large volumes of web logs or other business intelligence data.

trans-unit.source: Big Data tends to rely more on disk capacity and I/O performance than on CPU power, and might use specialized tools such as Apache Hadoop to manage the cluster and partition the data.
trans-unit.target: Big Data tends to rely more on disk capacity and I/O performance than on CPU power, and might use specialized tools such as Apache Hadoop to manage the cluster and partition the data.

trans-unit.source: (For information about Azure HDInsight and other Azure Hadoop solutions, see [Hadoop](https://azure.microsoft.com/solutions/hadoop/).)
trans-unit.target: (For information about Azure HDInsight and other Azure Hadoop solutions, see [Hadoop](https://azure.microsoft.com/solutions/hadoop/).)

trans-unit.source: Compute management and job scheduling
trans-unit.target: Compute management and job scheduling

trans-unit.source: Running Batch and HPC applications usually includes a *cluster manager* and a *job scheduler* to help manage clustered compute resources and allocate them to the applications that run the jobs.
trans-unit.target: Running Batch and HPC applications usually includes a *cluster manager* and a *job scheduler* to help manage clustered compute resources and allocate them to the applications that run the jobs.

trans-unit.source: These functions might be accomplished by separate tools, or an integrated tool or service.
trans-unit.target: These functions might be accomplished by separate tools, or an integrated tool or service.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster manager** - Provisions, releases, and administers compute resources (or compute nodes).
trans-unit.target: **Cluster manager** - Provisions, releases, and administers compute resources (or compute nodes).

trans-unit.source: A cluster manager might automate installation of operating system images and applications on compute nodes, scale compute resources according to demands, and monitor the performance of the nodes.
trans-unit.target: A cluster manager might automate installation of operating system images and applications on compute nodes, scale compute resources according to demands, and monitor the performance of the nodes.

trans-unit.source: **Job scheduler** - Specifies the resources (such as processors or memory) an application needs, and the conditions when it will run.
trans-unit.target: **Job scheduler** - Specifies the resources (such as processors or memory) an application needs, and the conditions when it will run.

trans-unit.source: A job scheduler maintains a queue of jobs and allocates resources to them based on an assigned priority or other characteristics.
trans-unit.target: A job scheduler maintains a queue of jobs and allocates resources to them based on an assigned priority or other characteristics.

trans-unit.source: Clustering and job scheduling tools for Windows-based and Linux-based clusters can migrate well to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Clustering and job scheduling tools for Windows-based and Linux-based clusters can migrate well to Azure.

trans-unit.source: For example, [Microsoft HPC Pack](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc514029), Microsoft’s free compute cluster solution for Windows and Linux HPC workloads, offers several options for running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: For example, [Microsoft HPC Pack](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc514029), Microsoft’s free compute cluster solution for Windows and Linux HPC workloads, offers several options for running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can also build Linux clusters to run open-source tools such as Torque and SLURM, or run commercial tools such as [TIBCO DataSynapse GridServer](http://www.tibco.com/products/automation/application-development/grid-computing/gridserver) and [Univa Grid Engine](http://www.univa.com/products/grid-engine) in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can also build Linux clusters to run open-source tools such as Torque and SLURM, or run commercial tools such as [TIBCO DataSynapse GridServer](http://www.tibco.com/products/automation/application-development/grid-computing/gridserver) and [Univa Grid Engine](http://www.univa.com/products/grid-engine) in Azure.

trans-unit.source: As shown in the following sections, you can also take advantage of Azure services to manage compute resources and schedule jobs without (or in addition to) traditional cluster management tools.
trans-unit.target: As shown in the following sections, you can also take advantage of Azure services to manage compute resources and schedule jobs without (or in addition to) traditional cluster management tools.

trans-unit.target: [Virtual Network](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-network/) - Creates a logically isolated section in Azure to connect Azure resources to your on-premises data center or a single client machine using IPSec; allows Big Compute applications to access on-premises data, Active Directory services, and license servers
